result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly K Heine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of  $243  + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 5/14/15 and on the 14th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 8 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly K Heine

defendant.name: Heine, Kimberly K
defendant.address: N5214 North Helenville Road, Helenville, WI 53137

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amended Time to Pay/ Payment Extension Reminder
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 8:31am [mo]
Defendant Kimberly K Heine in court with Attorney Jennifer Weber.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
--ADA Hall submits victim impact statement 
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Weber 

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of  $243  + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443, to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 5/14/15 and on the 14th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 8 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

The Court does not order for Ms. Heine to submit a DNA Sample  
recess8:48am
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 1, 2015 at 08:40 am.

case called at 2:04pm. [MK]
Defendant Kimberly K Heine in court with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.
recess 2:06pm.

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/1/15 at 8:40am (2)  Status Conference on 4/14/15 at 8:30am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

case called at 4:02pm. [MK]
Defendant Kimberly K Heine in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.  Ms. Heine indicates that she will be retaining Attorney Jennifer Weber in this case, however for today's hearing she is waiving her right to counsel.
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Heine in Traffic Forfeiture matters. The Court does not feel that any recusal is needed.
The charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance so that Attorney Weber can appear with Ms. Heine.

The Court requires $1,000 signature bond, with conditions: 
--not to issue any checks from the Sullivan Prestige Ambulance Inc. checking account 
--no presence at DJC CPA's and Advisors 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 4:11pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 3/3/15 at 2:00pm.
Note received from DA Staff along with new complaint requesting the matter be set 1/20/15 with prelim. in another matter
